comment: Avandia caused me to gain 18 lbs. in 4 mos. Water retention, swelling in legs, feet, face was pretty bad. I later discovered my doctor should not have put me on this because I have an enlarged heart, fatty liver, high blood pressure, and other problems. I am now looking for a new Doctor. And I have severe breathing problems and asthma since taking avandia.

This has been the only medication in combination with metformin that has successfully kept my blood sugars low.  I was taken off the medication and given others to try that have not worked and the side effects for me are worse (tiredness, weight gain) Avandia was the one that worked very well for me.  I'm hoping I will be able to go back to it.  I felt much better while on it.

I took this medication for 10 months by which time I had gained about 15 kgs, was out of breath and had swollen legs and hands.  I could only walk a few steps before being out of breath.  It brought the blood sugar down but the side effects were intolerable.  I would not recommend it to anyone.

On it for 6 years. Edema in ankles: but, worked very well for most of the years. At age 54 I see others that made comments are over 50. My weight gain;over eating! Now have had more heart palpations and BP went dangerously high. Family genetics....Heart trouble. Will miss 1 thing, I was not allergic to it like the others.

after taking avandia for approx. 5 months, I developed cirrossis of the liver and am now awaiting for a liver transplant. while taking avandia I gained 50 to 60 pounds and developed excess body fluid all over my body. I have joined a lawsuit against glaxo smith kline.

I just stopped Avandia and switched,by Dr. to ACTOS.  Blood sugar numbers were erratic without any reason, though overall dropped a bit. Problems with possible potassium retention causing multiple leg cramps, sometimes several times/day. Very concerned about FDA reports even though Dr. dismissed them as "rumor" and "bad research."

After experiencing Congestive Heart Failure in 2003, my doctors prescribed Avandia to treat my Diabetes II disease. While being observed by a cardiologist and a diabetes specialist, I took Avandia oral for 2 years until the FDA warned against its use. I never experienced any side effects and my blood sugar was effectively controlled with Metformin and Glyburide without insulin to an A1C of 6.8.

I have taken this medication for the last 10 years.  When I heard on the news about how this pill could cause heart attack, I stopped taking it immediately. Little did I know that this pill was the cause of my weight gain (more than 100 pounds in 10 years). I could never pin point what was the cuase of my weight gain.  When I stopped, I started loosing weight right away.  I have lost 40 pounds in 6 months.  Not only did it caused weight gain, I was retaining fluid in my legs, face, arms.  I was to the point of hardly walking.  I was fatigued with any minimal move, short of breath.  Now, I'm a new person.  I feel great, can walk very fast now. No shortness of breath.  I can go up the stairs with no problem at all. I feel that this pill took 10 years out of my life.  I'm 61 years old and now I feel so good that I can't stress enough how horrible this pill can be.
I am concerned about  weakness in the joints and being tired.  Vision seems to have become a little less clear.  Not sure if medication is the cause.  In the process of finding out.

comment: I was having trouble going up stairs.  People at diet club noticed I was swelling and said go see your doctor.  After the FDA blacked boxed Avandia, one doctor in the practice of interns, removed me from the medication.  Finally after many medical scares: very low blood pressure, very bad swelling, and itching rashes,  I was admitted to the hospital for further tests.  And put on a high protein diet.  It is very difficult and painful to rise out of a chair and and to walk. Arrangements with work have been difficult, since my job requires standing and a great deal of walking.  But with FML I have 30 days off to recover.

4 mg Avandia used once per day with Glipizide xl 10 mg 2 times per day with food. Side effects are nerveousness (hypoglycemia)and falling to sleep (ex.) while reading the newspaper after breakfast. A1C test is acceptable, Blood pressure with medication is acceptable. Within the last 2 months I have had an echo-cardiogram Stress test which was acceptable even though I did not reach the (74 year old) aerobic rate (just-short of). The Test was performed after recent death of (1) male sibling do to heart failure at age 64--Preceeded by prior death of (1) male sibling at age 48--Preceeded by death of (female) sibling at age 41. My concern was over the possible genetic pre-disposition or congenital linkage. The cardiologist concluded (after the echo-cardiogram with stress) that my heart was "OK" for a male of 74 years of age. He recommended to my family Dr. that I should be tested every 2 years. Should I be concerned about taking avandia?
It has been awondeful drug for me,  have just recently had to increase dosage

This drug nearly killed me! It cause edema everywhere, especially in heart/chest cavity. I felt so bad I was sure I was dying (found out later I was a small step from a heart attack). I happened to tell my Mom one day how bad I felt and that I was taking Avandia. She flipped and told me to stop taking ASAP, then told me of the side effects being advetised on TV. She was right as it turned out. It took 4 months for all the side effects to completely disappear. Then I felt great until metformin & glipizide weren't enough, so started Byetta. What a wonderful drug! Lost over 45 pounds in less than 7 months w/o even trying, blood sugars are normal & HbA1c is down to 6.1 from 8. Endocrinologist expects diabetes to disappear with enough weight loss. Avandia can be a killer, so beware!
